unnormalised: So, you're looking for the address of a good property in Bangalore? Understanding the address format here is key. Typically, you'll see things like "No. 25, 1st Main, 2nd Cross, Malleshwaram, Bangalore, 560003". The "No." refers to the house or building number. "1st Main" and "2nd Cross" are street names, indicating the location within the layout. Malleshwaram is the locality or neighbourhood. Finally, 560003 is the PIN code (Postal Index Number), which is crucial for accurate mail delivery and location identification.
normalised: So, you're looking for the address of a good property in Bangalore? Understanding the address format here is key. Typically, you'll see things like "Number twenty five, first Main, second Cross, Malleshwaram, Bangalore, five hundred and sixty triple zero three". The "Number" refers to the house or building number. "first Main" and "second Cross" are street names, indicating the location within the layout. Malleshwaram is the locality or neighbourhood. Finally, five hundred and sixty triple zero three is the P-I-N code (Postal Index Number), which is crucial for accurate mail delivery and location identification.

unnormalised: Now, let's say you see an address like "Site # 12, Sector 6, HSR Layout, Bangalore - 560102". "Site #" is similar to "No." but sometimes used for plots of land rather than built structures. "Sector 6" is a division within the larger "HSR Layout". The PIN code, 560102, confirms the specific area. Be aware that addresses can vary, especially in older areas where numbering may not be sequential.
normalised: Now, let's say you see an address like "Site hash twelve, Sector six, H-S-R Layout, Bangalore - five hundred and sixty one hundred and two". "Site hash" is similar to "Number" but sometimes used for plots of land rather than built structures. "Sector six" is a division within the larger "H-S-R Layout". The P-I-N code, five hundred and sixty one hundred and two, confirms the specific area. Be aware that addresses can vary, especially in older areas where numbering may not be sequential.

unnormalised: When researching properties, pay attention to abbreviations like "Rd" for Road, "St" for Street, "Ln" for Lane, or "Extn" for Extension. Also, property listings may include landmarks: "Near MG Road metro station, Bangalore, 560001" helps to pinpoint the exact location. Always verify the address with official documents, like the property's title deed, to ensure accuracy.
normalised: When researching properties, pay attention to abbreviations like "Road" for Road, "Street" for Street, "Lane" for Lane, or "Extension" for Extension. Also, property listings may include landmarks: "Near M-G Road metro station, Bangalore, five hundred and sixty triple zero one" helps to pinpoint the exact location. Always verify the address with official documents, like the property's title deed, to ensure accuracy.
